thread.title: Arsenal news: Robert Lewandowski issues warning to Gunners ahead of second leg | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Robert Lewandowski issues warning to Gunners ahead of second leg | Metro News

author: Coral Barry For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Robert Lewandowski issues warning to Gunners ahead of second leg | Metro News
text:
Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 9:04 am Robert Lewandowski kicked off a Bayern Munch scoring spree in the second half (Picture: Getty) 
Robert Lewandowski has warned his Bayern Munich team-mates they must be as ruthless against Arsenal in the second leg of their Champions League last-16 tie as they were in Munich. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
Bayern smashed Arsenal 5-1 in front of their home fans to virtually end all hope of the Gunners progressing into the next round. 
The second leg is on March 7 and the tie may be dead in the water, but Lewandowski wants a repeat of the Munich mauling. 
‘Great show! Spectacular evening for us and powerful 45 minutes,’ he said. A post shared by Robert Lewandowski (@_rl9) on Feb 15, 2017 at 2:36pm PST 
‘But we need to stay conscious for the rematch.’ 
Arsenal were level at half-time before a extreme capitulation in the second 45 minutes included conceding three goals in just ten minutes. 
No Champions League side has ever overturned a four goal deficit with Arsenal massively unlikely to hit four past Bayern without reply. First leg stats – Arsenal concede 5 goals for the first time since Nov 2015 v Bayern– First time Arsenal have conceded 5 goals in first leg of CL tie– Arsenal have conceded 3+ goals in 4 of their last 6 first-leg matches in the last 16– First time Arsenal have conceded 4 goals in one half since March 2014 v Chelsea– Lewandowski has scored 15 goals in his last 13 CL games at the Allianz Arena Bayern destroyed Arsenal in the second half (Picture: Getty)
